channel.title: The Anarchist Cookbook!
channel.description: Here is a copy of the anarchist cookbook. plz be responsible when using this ;D btw, we never had this topic started :|

item.title: The Anarchist Cookbook!
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

Mopman:

Also, even the federal mafia wasn’t banned from being sold altogether, and it most definitely isn’t illegal to OWN it. Only a handful of people, who were also implicated in other crimes (the author is currently in jail for tax crimes) were banned from providing it.

You are right. I haven’t proven that it’s illegal to own the book, just illegal for the book to be sold in the store. Ugh, can’t look into this topic anymore. Parents are angry.

Read full topic

item.title: The Anarchist Cookbook!
item.dc:creator: @1337h4x 1337h4x
item.description:
@1337h4x wrote:

Fucking nazi government, banning books. Fuck democracy.

Read full topic

item.title: The Anarchist Cookbook!
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

A book which contains fraudulent information, tells people to commit fraud and even provides a tax return for them (which is in itself a crime, as far as I know) is a bit different to a book that tells people to make a bomb out of a tennis ball. From what I know about law (and that isn’t a lot), The Federal Mafia was illegal anyway. I’m not saying that makes it right, but it’s different from the anarchists cookbook in so many ways.

Also, even the federal mafia wasn’t banned from being sold altogether, and it most definitely isn’t illegal to OWN it. Only a handful of people, who were also implicated in other crimes (the author is currently in jail for tax crimes) were banned from providing it.

Read full topic

item.title: The Anarchist Cookbook!
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:47, topic:4936”]OK, well, you are wrong, but I know better than to try to persuade you of this, from the packet sniffing thread.
So, enjoy not reading Catcher in the Rye because you might get arrested. :)[/quote]
I actually did read that book.

And learn to read the webpage I posted. If I can do you the courtesy of hearing you out, you can at least do the same.

Edit: Read this one. It’s very recent.
http://www.newswithviews.com/NWVexclusive/exclusive1.htm

On March 19, 2003, Federal Judge Lloyd George ordered Schiff to stop selling his book "The Federal Mafia" which has been in print for over 13 years. According to Schiff the Federal Government is using the American people's preoccupation with the war in Iraq as an opportunity to squelch freedom here at home.

Read full topic

item.title: The Anarchist Cookbook!
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

frank_:

it didnt say it can go further, it says it does go further, it then states that it gets removed from libraries and schools

Link:http://www.booksatoz.com/censorship/banned.htm

Every year, books in the U.S. and around the world are challenged. Some of the challenged books are banned, some aren't. The punishment for ignoring these bans range from almost [b]nonexistent to severe[/b].

It can go much further.

you are pretty fucking stupid for a mod
And for a human, you're a real prick.

Read full topic

[/quote]

item.title: The Anarchist Cookbook!
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Can you actually read, or not?

That short phrase is really very clear, yet you seem to have no comprehended it at all. I recommend sticking it on a post-it above your bed or something, because “going further” is removing it from the classroom or library circulation (in the case of a government ban, state libraries/schools). This is “further”. There is no “even further”.

Read full topic

item.title: The Anarchist Cookbook!
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:36, topic:4936”]No, it most certainly dosen’t. That hasn’t happened for like 50 years now.

EDIT: What do you mean any law can have an exception?[/quote]

Laws have exceptions all the time. Such as… If someone was attacking you and you grabbed a shovel and he ran up to you and you hit him in the head and he died. You’re trialed for murder, but you get off because there is an exception because it was self defense.

Mopman:

[quote=About.Com]Books are banned or challenged every day. But, does that mean? A challenge is an attempt to remove or restrict material. A book ban goes even further–the work is removed from the classroom or library circulation.[/quote]

So it can go further.

Read full topic

item.title: The Anarchist Cookbook!
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

Mopman:

No, they cannot make it illegal to own a book.

Read that: http://www.anarchist-cookbook.com/

Right now you have to be 21 to buy it, which I wasn’t aware of. Thought it was illegal already. It will be illegal in another year or two. And if you didn’t know, the gov’t can do whatever the fuck they want, and if you don’t believe that, then you epitomize the norm for American Youth.

Edit: Here is a whole list of banned books in the US.
http://onlinebooks.library.upenn.edu/banned-books.html

Read full topic

item.title: The Anarchist Cookbook!
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:29, topic:4936”][quote author=KyleGut3 link=topic=6446.msg395414#msg395414 date=1162619310]
Except by purchasing this book with a creditcard or renting it with a librarycard, you are automatically put ona government list as a potential terrorist. same with Mein Kampf.
[/quote]

Uhh… no.[/quote]

This book has been banned in the United States. Owning it is illegal and can get you arrested. If you’re younger than 18, than your parent(s)/guardian(s) are liable.

Read full topic
